subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about tax filing in Bangladesh

questions.question: Who is legally required to file an income tax return in Bangladesh?
questions.answer:
You must file a tax return if:

• Your total taxable income exceeds the tax-free threshold; or
• You have a TIN; or
• You own a car, own/lease a flat in a city corporation area, have a trade license, run a business, are a company director, or meet any other mandatory filing criteria under NBR.

questions.question: When should I file my tax return, and how often am I legally required to file?
questions.answer: Once every year.\n\nFiling deadline for individuals: 30 November of each assessment year.

questions.question: What are the penalties for failing to file a tax return on time?
questions.answer:
Minimum penalty: BDT 1,000.

• 10% of last assessed tax (where applicable).
• BDT 50 per day additional penalty for continued delay.
• Loss of privileges (certificate, trade license renewal, credit facilities).

questions.question: What are the penalties for providing incorrect or incomplete information?
questions.answer:
Considered concealment or false return.

Penalty: up to 5 years imprisonment, or fine, or both.

Additional tax/penalty on concealed income may apply.

questions.question: What types of income must be declared in a tax return?
questions.answer:
All income sources, including:

• Salary
• Business/professional/freelancing income
• Rental income
• Interest, dividends, capital gains
• Any other taxable receipts

questions.question: Do I need to file if tax was already deducted at source by my employer?
questions.answer: Yes, if your income exceeds the threshold or you meet any mandatory filing criteria.\n\nTDS does not remove the requirement to file.

questions.question: Do I need to file taxes if I only have salary income?
questions.answer: Yes, if your salary exceeds the tax-free threshold or you hold a TIN.\n\nNo, only if your income is below threshold AND you are not in any mandatory category.

questions.question: Do I need to declare income from freelancing or side jobs?
questions.answer: Yes. Freelance, outsourcing, online, or side-job income is fully taxable and must be declared.

questions.question: Do I need to file taxes if I only earn rental income?
questions.answer: Yes. Rental income is taxable and must be included in your return.

questions.question: What documents are legally required to support a tax return?
questions.answer:
Typically required:

• TIN & NID
• Salary certificate / proof of income
• Bank statements (for interest or income)
• Rental agreements (if applicable)
• Investment/profit statements
• Asset & liability information
• Previous year's return (if any)

questions.question: What is the legal difference between an e-TIN and a TIN certificate?
questions.answer:
e-TIN: The actual 12-digit Taxpayer Identification Number issued electronically.

TIN certificate: The document showing your TIN.

They represent the same registration; one is the number; one is the proof.

questions.question: Is it mandatory to update TIN information if I change my address or profession?
questions.answer: Yes. You must keep your TIN profile's address, profession, and personal details updated.\n\nIncorrect information may result in penalties.

questions.question: How do I legally correct mistakes in my tax return after submission?
questions.answer:
You can file a Revised Return.

Must be submitted before assessment is completed by the tax authority.

Unintentional mistakes can be corrected; intentional concealment remains punishable.
